intro: Sceletium, commonly known as kanna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Sceletium species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its historical use by indigenous peoples for its psychoactive properties has led to ongoing research into its potential medicinal applications.
